intro: Salpinctes, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads, aiding in wind pollination and seed dispersal. Salpinctes typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in alpine ecosystems.
